ArticleTitle.sentence: Characterization of a cofactor that regulates dimerization of a mammalian homeodomain protein.

event.clue: Characterization of a cofactor that regulates dimerization of a mammalian homeodomain protein.
event.comment: NER: T1 sem mod, Protein_family_or_group -> Protein_molecule

event.clue: Characterization of a cofactor that regulates dimerization of a mammalian homeodomain protein.

AbstractText.sentence: Dimerization among transcription factors has become a recurrent theme in the regulation of eukaryotic gene expression.

event.clue: Dimerization among transcription factors has become a recurrent theme in the regulation of eukaryotic gene expression.
Dimerization among transcription factors has become a recurrent theme in the regulation of eukaryotic gene expression.

AbstractText.sentence: Hepatocyte nuclear factor-1 alpha (HNF-1 alpha) is a homeodomain-containing protein that functions as a dimer.
A dimerization cofactor of HNF-1 alpha (DCoH) was identified that displayed a restricted tissue distribution and did not bind to DNA, but, rather, selectively stabilized HNF-1 alpha dimers.

event.clue: A dimerization cofactor of HNF-1 alpha (DCoH) was identified that displayed a restricted tissue distribution and did not bind to DNA, but, rather, selectively stabilized HNF-1 alpha dimers.

event.comment: NER: T10 in S4 sem mod, Protein_family_or_group -> Protein_complex

AbstractText.sentence: The formation of a stable tetrameric DCoH-HNF-1 alpha complex, which required the dimerization domain of HNF-1 alpha, did not change the DNA binding characteristics of HNF-1 alpha, but enhanced its transcriptional activity.

AbstractText.sentence: However, DCoH did not confer transcriptional activation to the GAL4 DNA binding domain.

AbstractText.sentence: These results indicate that DCoH regulates formation of transcriptionally active tetrameric complexes and may contribute to the developmental specificity of the complex.
